1.text: Scoop out a piece of clay about the size of an egg.

2.text: Roll the clay into a ball between your palms.

3.text: Mold the clay into a teardrop shape.

4.text: Bend the tip of the teardrop up to make a little tail.

5.text: Roll another clay ball about 1/3 the size of the bird's body for its head.

6.text: Press the head firmly onto the thick end of the body.

7.text: Poke 2 holes in the head for the bird’s eye sockets.

8.text: Add 2 small clay balls for the bird’s eyes.

9.text: Mold a little cone for the bird’s beak.

10.text: Make 2 flat teardrop shapes for the bird’s wings.

11.text: Flatten an egg-sized piece of clay onto a table.

12.text: Press a bird-shaped cookie cutter into the clay.

13.text: Peel away the excess clay around the cookie cutter.

14.text: Draw an eye and a wing onto the bird with a pen or toothpick.

15.text: Flip the bird over to decorate the other side.

16.text: Leave the clay to dry for 24 hours.
